title: Poppy E Tweak Suggestion
body:
I would like Poppy to be able to start E animation on someone, then mid-animation, flash to shove enemy further than normal. This currently does not seem to be a thing and I wish it was.  That is all I had to discuss. Thank you for your time.  
{{sticker:sg-soraka}}

replies.body:
Because of how weird Poppy's e works, that ocding could destroy your own Nexus...

It is a dash, that pulls people, but they can use spells while being dragged (what is bs btw. since Heca's e moves you even if you flash over a wall), making it able to move out of it.
It stuns when dahs against a wall, but Poppy has to hit the wall and not the target.
The ability is just so weird.

Fun little suggestion but not one I think would be healthy for the game. While I would love to play Kidnapper Poppy and flash drag people over a wall into my team, that would go against both the design of the ability and the design of the champion. 

Poppy and her E are meant to be simple, allowing for some versatility through creative play but also being very clearly defined in their use and limitations. You know exactly what her E will do, your opponents also know exactly what her E will do. It's an ability that defines her disruptor playstyle while also punishing players who do not respect her. This is perfect from both a gameplay and thematic standpoint. This kind of change would open Poppy to avenues she was never meant to cross, and the game would suffer for it.

This is perfect from both a gameplay and thematic standpoint. This kind of change would open Poppy to avenues she was never meant to cross, and the game would suffer for it.

I wasn't suggesting over walls. I was suggesting into walls if you were previously too far away to get the stun.  The ability would still stop at walls, stun the target and send you over the wall if you flashed there while leaving them behind (albeit stunned) or it could cause you to waste your flash entirely by stopping your flash at the wall with the stunned person instead of sending you over regardless of where you tried to flash to.
I don't know much about coding, but I could imagine that implementing this would be quite a hustle.
For now i'd be happy if they made it so where people couldn't just flash/dash/jump out of her e duration. That would be a big buff there lol.{{champion:78}}
